Name: Satoyoshi syndrome
Synonyms_List__c: Komuragaeri Disease, Muscle spasms, intermittent with alopecia, diarrhea and skeletal abnormalities
Disease_Description__c: Satoyoshi syndrome is a rare disorder characterized by progressive, painful, intermittent muscle spasms, diarrhea or unusual malabsorption, endocrinopathy with amenorrhea, and secondary skeletal abnormalities. The disorder is also called komuragaeri disease by the Japanese; in Japanese 'komura' means calf and 'gaeri' means 'turnover' or spasm. All cases have apparently been sporadic, even when occurring in large families (Ehlayel and Lacassie, 1995).
